message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to start with an initial offer of $18,000 for the product.

Thank you for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate your enthusiasm, $18,000 is a bit more than I'm willing to spend.  I'm prepared to offer $13,000 for the product, which I believe is a fair starting point for negotiation.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, $13,000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $16,000 for the product. This is my best counteroffer so far.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $16,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm confident that we can find a mutually agreeable price.  My final offer is $14,000. If this doesn't work for you, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're trying to find a sweet spot, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $14,000. I'm willing to make another counteroffer of $17,000 for the product. This is my last concession before we reach the upper limit of my willingness to sell.
